Description: Body sherd of Chian, possibly Simple Animal Style, pottery chalice; white slip; interior: glazed streaky black with two added white bands; exterior: trace of chequer pattern at rim (now lost), reserved below; inscription on exterior.
Curator's comments: The sherd belongs to the same vessel as British Museum 1924,1201.852. Type B kantharoi typically have a painted inscription beneath the rim. They do not however, have rim patterns. The rim pattern on this sherd is consistent with some Chalice Style chalices.
Bibliographic references: Cook & Woodhead 1952 / Painted Inscriptions on Chiot Pottery (p. 169, no. 177)
Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 730, no. 901)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0969) (phase 2)
